botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Contact may irritate the skin. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Paeonia may be herbaceous perennials or deciduous sub-shrubs with large, divided leaves and showy large bowl-shaped flowers, usually in early summer

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in deep, rich, well-drained soil, ideally in full sun but will tolerate light shade. Will not tolerate waterlogging. Intersectional peonies will not usually need staking. See herbaceous peony cultivation for more detailed advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by division, lifting and dividing established clumps in autumn
how_to_grow.pruning: Cut back to ground level in autumn, to remove dead foliage and reduce the risk of disease
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to leaf and bud eelworm and swift moth caterpillar
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to peony wilt, verticillium wilt, peony leaf blotch and virus diseases
